question.content: In which of the following states are Aus, Boro and Aman paddy crops grown in a year?

solution.content: Odisha. Aman, Aus and Boro are rice varieties. Rice is usually sown thrice in a year. Aman: This variety is sown in the rainy season (July-August) and harvested in winter. Aus: Rice sown in summer along with the pre-monsoonal showers and harvested in autumn. Boro: Rice sown in winter and harvested in summer. This is also called spring rice.

question.content: In which state is the Sanchi Stupa situated?

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. The Sanchi Stupa was discovered by Sir Henry Taylor in 1818. Sanchi Stupa was declared as a world heritage site by UNESCO (1989).

question.content: located in Bharhut Stupa is which of the following states?

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Bharhut is famous for the ruins of a Buddhist stupa (shrine) discovered there by Major General Alexander Cunningham in 1873. The stupa's sculptural remains are now mainly preserved in the Indian Museum, Kolkata, and in the Municipal Museum of Allahabad.

question.content: In which state of India is Kaziranga National Park located?

solution.content: Assam. Kaziranga National Park A UNESCO world heritage site of India and known for one horned Rhinoceros. National Parks in India: Jim Corbett National Park Uttarakhand, Ranthambore National Park - Rajasthan, Blackbuck National Park, Gir National Park Gujarat. Kanha National Park Madhya Pradesh, Bhitarkanika National Park Odisha.

question.content: According to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry (2018-19), which state of India is the largest producer of Rubber?

solution.content: Kerala (490460 tonnes). Total production of Natural Rubber (NR) during 2018-19 is estimated at 648000 tonnes and in 2017-18 is 694000 tonnes. Top Natural Rubber producing Indian States: Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Tripura, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram.

question.content: Which of the following states has introduced a dedicated Semiconductor Policy 2022- 27 with a view to generate at least 2,00,000 new employment opportunities in the state?

solution.content: Gujarat. Semiconductor Policy (2022-27) will facilitate the eligible projects for land allotment, enable expedited process approvals, ready access to utilities such as power, water, gas and other industrial infrastructure. Other Schemes of employment: SAUNI (Saurashtra Narmada Avtaran Irrigation, 2012), Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA, 2005).

question.content: In which state is Vijay Stambh situated?

solution.content: Rajasthan. Vijay Stambh (Tower of Victory) was built by Maharana Kumbha between 1440 AD and 1448 AD to commemorate his victory over combined armies of Gujarat and Malwa led by Mahmud Khilji. It is situated inside Chittor Fort in Chittorgarh. This tower is dedicated to Hindu God Vishnu.

question.content: Birsa Munda Hockey Stadium was built in which state?

solution.content: Odisha. The Guinness Book of World Records has officially recognised the Birsa Munda Hockey Stadium in Rourkela as the world's largest fully seated hockey stadium (As of September 2023). It acted as the second venue for the Hockey World Cup 2023. Ноckey Stadiums: Biju Patnaik Hockey Stadium (Odisha), Dhanraj Pillay Hockey Stadium (Maharashtra), Astro Turf Hockey Stadium (Jharkhand).

question.content: In which city is the Rajghat memorial situated?

solution.content: Delhi. Famous Memorials in Delhi: Shanti Van (Jawaharlal Nehru), Vijay Ghat (Lal Bahadur Shastri), Shakti Sthal (Indira Gandhi), Sadaiv Atal (Atal Bihari Vajpayee), Vir Bhumi (Rajiv Gandhi), Samta Sthal (Babu Jagjivan Ram), Sangharsh Sthal (Chaudhary Devi Lal).

question.content: Dr. Teejan Bai, who was awarded by Padma Vibhushan (2019) renowned Indian folk singer performer from the state of is a and

solution.content: Chhattisgarh. Other Awards Padma Bhushan (2003), Padma Shri (1988). States and their Folk dances: Chhattisgarh Raut Nacha, Panthi, Soowa, Karma, Saila. Assam Bihu, jhumur dance, Bagurumba. Himachal Pradesh Nati, Kulluvi Nati, Chamba, Gaddi, Kinnauri.

question.content: Where is the Vivekanand Rock Memorial situated?

solution.content: Kanyakumari (Tamil Nadu). Vivekananda Rock Memorial - Its construction was completed in 1970. Swami Vivekananda visited Kanyakumari in 1892. He was a disciple of Ramakrishna Paramahamsa and the founder of Ramakrishna Mission. The memorial consists of two main structures, the Vivekananda Mandapam and the Shripada Mandapam.

question.content: Rann Utsav is celebrated in which of the following states?

solution.content: Gujarat. Rann Utsav - It was conceptualised as a three-day festival, which progressively evolved into a 100-day celebration at Dhordo, a village near Rann of Kutch. States and Festivals: Gujarat Navratri, Janmashtami, Kutch Utsav, Uttarayana, Punjab Lohri, Baisakhi, Haryana The Kurukshetra Festival, Goa Shigmo, Sunburn festival, Ladain, Mando.

question.content: Which of the following states has the honour of being India's first carbon-free state?

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh (India's first and the world's second carbon-free state). A state is carbon-free if all of its electricity is from clean energy sources like wind, solar, and nuclear. First carbon neutral district Majuli (Assam). First carbon free panchayat Pali Village (Jammu and Kashmir). Bhutan is the first carbon negative country in the world.

question.content: Which Indian state is renowned for the traditional canal irrigation method known as 'Kulh'?

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. Kuhls are shallow surface channels diverting water from naturally flowing streams or springs, to cultivated fields, and mainly used for flood irrigation. Water Harvesting Structures found in other states: Kerala and Karnataka (Kattas, Surangams), Maharashtra (Bandharas and Tals), Tamil Nadu (Eris), Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh (Bundhis).

question.content: According to the Indian Minerals Yearbook 2020, which state in India has the highest share of limestone production?

solution.content: Rajasthan. Limestone (Calcium Carbonate (CaCO3)). Mineral Producing State: Iron ore Orissa, Chattisgarh, Karnataka.Manganese -Orissa, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh. Gold Bihar, Rajasthan, Karnataka. Diamond Madhya Pradesh. Coal Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Orissa.

question.content: Which Indian state was the first to make it mandatory for all homes to have rooftop rainwater harvesting structures?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. Rooftop rainwater harvesting is a technique used for the conservation of water. The rainwater that has fallen on the roof of houses or buildings is collected in storage or underground tanks through the help of pipes in this technique. This helps in recharging the groundwater levels. Rainwater harvesting is already a common practice in Mizoram.

question.content: Lotia is a regional music form of which state?

solution.content: Rajasthan. Lotia - It is sung by the peasants while working in the fields on the occasion of Lotia festival in the Chaitra month according to the Hindu calendar. Women bring lotas (a vessel to fill water) and kalash (a vessel considered to be auspicious to fill water during worship) filled with water from ponds and wells. Traditional Folk Music of Rajasthan Pabuji Ki Phach, Maand, Panihari.

question.content: In which state is the Maski inscription located at present?

solution.content: Karnataka. Maski inscription: Ashoka's minor rock edict. It is situated on the banks of the Muski River, a tributary of the Tungabhadra River. The inscription is written in the Brahmi script. The edict was the first of Emperor Ashoka to include the name Ashoka and not by his usual Title 'Devanampiya Piyadasi'. Discovered by - C. Beadon in 1915.

question.content: Which of the following states used EVMs for the first time in the general elections held in May 1982?

solution.content: Kerala (Ernakulam, Parvur Vidhan Sabha). Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) - In 1989, the Parliament amended the Representation of the People Act, 1951 to create a provision for the use of EVMs in the elections. EVM consists of two units - Control Unit (CU) and Balloting Unit (BU).

question.content: The Ravan Phadi cave in is an example of the early Chalukya style architecture which is known for its distinct sculptural style.

solution.content: Karnataka. Ravana Phadi Cave Temple is one of the jewels in the Aihole monuments. Other Historic Caves: Maharashtra Ajanta Caves, Ellora Caves, Elephanta Caves. Kerala Edakkal caves, Maniyoor caves, Ezhuthupara cave. Andhra Pradesh- Erravaram Caves, Belum Caves, Akkanna Madanna Caves.

question.content: The famous Dhamek Stupa is located in which of the following states?

solution.content: Uttar Pradesh. Dhamek Stupa- It is located at Sarnath, in Varanasi. It was built in 249 B.C. by Ashoka the Great. It was made to commemorate the event of Lord Buddha giving the first sermon to his first five disciples. Other stupas: Swayambhunath Stupa Kathmandu (Nepal), Bharhut Stupa - Satna District (Madhya Pradesh), Kesariya Stupa Champaran District (Bihar), Sanchi Stupa Raisen District (Madhya Pradesh), Chaukhandi Stupa Varanasi (Uttar Pradesh).

question.content: Which among the following Buddhist Universities is located in Bihar, India?

solution.content: Nalanda University (The world's first residential University) - Built by Kumaragupta (Gupta dynasty). Prominent Rulers - Harshavardhana of Kannauj, Pala Rulers, and many scholars patronized Nalanda.

question.content: The head office of National Bank for Agricultural and Rural Development is located in _

solution.content: Mumbai. NABARD (National Bank for Agricultural and Rural Development) is administered by the Government of India. It was instituted on the recommendations of B.Sivaraman Committee on 12 July 1982 by implementing the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development Act 1981.

question.content: Bagh Caves, which has 9 Buddhist caves, was developed around the 6th Century AD situated on the Bagh river in

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh. Bagh Caves - These are a group of nine Buddhist caves, first discovered in 1818, located on the bank of the Baghani River in Dhar district, Madhya Pradesh. Other caves: Madhya Pradesh Udayagiri Caves (Vidisha), Pandav Caves (Pachmarhi), Dharmrajeshwar Caves (Mandsaur), Bhimbetka Caves (Bhojpur Raisen), Lohani Caves (Mandu) etc.

question.content: Which Indian state is home to the Buddhist cave temples known as Barabar Caves?

solution.content: Bihar. The Barabar Hill Caves are the oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India. These are supposed to have been constructed by emperor Ashoka for the use of Ajivaka ascetics. These caves are situated in the twin hills of Barabar (four caves) and Nagarjuni (three caves). Most caves at Barabar consist of two chambers, carved entirely out of granite.

question.content: The rock cave temple of _ is the largest monolithic structure in the world.

solution.content: с) (b) Ajanta (d) Badami Ellora. The caves are dedicated to Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism. The Kailasa Temple (Ellora): It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is located in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra, India. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is the largest and most impressive cave in the Ellora complex. It is a monolithic structure (carved out of a single rock).

question.content: The Elephanta Caves are located in which state?

solution.content: Maharashtra. Elephanta Caves: Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1987.

question.content: Which city in India is associated with the tea industry?

solution.content: Darjeeling, West Bengal. Darjeeling Tea was the first product to get the Geographical Indication (GI) tag in India, in October 2004. Kangra Tea from Himachal Pradesh also has Gl tag status. GI tag is regulated by the Geographical Indications of Goods (Registration and Protection) Act of 1999.

question.content: The Ganesh-rath is one of the finest monolithic temples located in

solution.content: Mahabalipuram. The Ganesh rath It is one of ten rathas ("chariots") carved out of pink granite within the group of monuments of the Pallava Period at Mahabalipuram, a UNESCO-inscribed World Heritage Site since 1984.

question.content: Which state became the first to implement "New Education Policy" at pre-primary level?

solution.content: Uttarakhand. National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 was announced by the Ministry of Education. It was based on the recommendation of the 'Kasturiranjan committee'. Aim- Transform the Indian education system to meet the needs of the 21 st Century. Karnataka became the first state to adopt NEP in higher education.

question.content: The famous Pandav Leni Caves is located in which of the following states?

solution.content: Maharashtra. Pandavleni Caves These are built on the Tri Rashmi hill about 3004 feet above sea level. These caves are a group of old Buddhist caves (250 В.С. 600 A.D.).

question.content: Dhuska is the most popular food item of state of

solution.content: Jharkhand. Other Foods of Jharkhand- Handia, Litti Chokha, Mirchi Ka Salan, Mitha Khaja, Rugra. Punjab: Sarso ka saag and Makki di Roti, Lassi, Gobhi Shalgam- Gajar Pickle, Pinni. Kerala: Erissery, Sadya, Appam With Ishtu, Idli Sambar, Nadan Kozhi Varuthathu. Andhra Pradesh: Pulihora, Gutti vankaya kura, Chepa Pulusu, Gongura Pickle Ambadi, Pesarattu, Gutti Vankaya Koora, Punugulu, Bobbatlu, Medu Vada, Uppindi.

question.content: Kye Gompa, the largest centre of Buddhist learning in the Western Himalayas, is situated in the state/union territory of_

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. Famous Buddhist monasteries: Hemis Monastery - Ladakh, Tabo Monastery Himachal Pradesh, Tsuglagkhang Monastery Himachal Pradesh, Thiksey Monastery Leh, Ladakh, Tawang Monastery Arunachal Pradesh, Bylakuppe Monastery (Namdroling) Karnataka, Ghoom Monastery West Bengal, Lingdum Monastery - Sikkim.

question.content: Aga Khan Palace is located in _ city of Maharashtra.

solution.content: Pune. This Palace was built in 1892 by Sultan Muhammed Shah Aga Khan III in the district of Pune (Maharashtra).

question.content: Which Indian city is also known as Queen of Deccan?

solution.content: Pune. Some Indian Cities and Sobriquets: City of Taj - Agra (Uttar Pradesh), Boston/Manchester of India Ahmedabad (Gujarat), Sangam City Allahabad (Uttar Pradesh), Land of Black Diamond Asansol (West Bengal), City of Peace- Bardhaman (West Bengal), Temple City of India Bhubaneswar (Odisha), The Venice of the East Alappuzha (Kerala), Garden City of India - Bengaluru (Karnataka), Detroit of Asia Chennai (Tamil Nadu), Manchester of South India Coimbatore (Tamil Nadu), Scotland of India Coorg (Karnataka), School Capital of India Dehradun (Uttarakhand), Queen of the Hills- Darjeeling (West Bengal).

question.content: Which among the following is an Indian martial art from Manipur?

solution.content: Thang-Tai (sword and spear) - It is dedicated to fighting skill and worship. The Meitei creation of Thang-ga goes back to antiquity.

question.content: India's First open Rock Museum is located in which city?

solution.content: Hyderabad. Other Famous monuments: Char- Minar, Makka Masjid both built by Quli Qutub Shah.

question.content: Nasik is also known as capital of India.

solution.content: Wine. Nashik ("Wine Capital of India") holds almost half of the wineries in India. Wine is composed of ethanol (12%). Nashik is situated on the banks of river Godavari. The Godavari starts from Trimbakeshwar, Maharashtra and flows to the Bay of Bengal. It is also known for hosting the Kumbh Mela every 12 years.

question.content: Which among the following is the official sport of Maharashtra, as of 2022?

solution.content: Dahi Handi. It is an entertainment and competitive event celebrated with Hindu festival Krishna Janmashtami (birth of god Krishna). Madhya Pradesh (Mallakhamb), Kerala (Kalaripayattu). Puri Beach (Odisha) - Here, Sudarsan Pattnaik showcases his sand arts. Mysore Sand Sculpture Museum - It is home to several sand models and was founded by M N Gowri.

question.content: "Living root bridges" is an iconic structure found in which state?

solution.content: Meghalaya. Living root bridges (Jing Kieng Jri) The aerial bridges, built by weaving and adjusting the roots of the Indian rubber tree. Other Famous root bridges - Riwai Root Bridge and Umshiang Double Decker Bridge. Properties Elastic, easily combined, grows in rough and rocky soils. Grown by Khasi and Jaintia tribes of Meghalaya.

question.content: Surat is also of India. known

solution.content: Diamond city. It is also known as "The silk city", and "The green city". Surat (located on the River Tapi) has been called "The gateway to Mecca". Old name of Surat - Suryapur.

question.content: Which of the following sites do "Not" have nuclear power plants?

solution.content: Vijayawada. Nuclear power plants in India: Kakrapar Atomic Power Station (1993, Gujarat), Kalpakkam, Madras (1984, Tamil Nadu), Narora (1991, Uttar Pradesh), Kaiga (2000; Karnataka), Rawatbhata (1973, Rajasthan), Tarapur (1969, Maharashtra), Kudankulam (2013, Tamil Nadu). Under Construction: Chutka (Madhya Pradesh), Gorakhpur (Haryana), Bhimpur (Madhya Pradesh), Mahi Banswara (Rajasthan), Haripur (West Bengal), etc.

question.content: In which of the following states was 'Kudumbashree, women-oriented, community-- based, poverty-reduction programme implemented?

solution.content: Kerala. The name Kudumbashree in Malayalam language means 'prosperity of the family'. The 'Kudumbashree' SHG (Self Help Groups) was started in 1998.

question.content: end-to-end launched in India's digital First Lok Al-powered, Adalat was

solution.content: Rajasthan. Launched by National Legal Services Authority Chairman, Uday Umesh Lalit. About Rajasthan (northwest) - Capital: Jaipur.

question.content: Which of the following is the first 'smoke-free state' in India?

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. This was achieved due to the Ujjwala Scheme (2016, by centre) and Grahini Suvidha Yojana (2018, by Himachal Pradesh Government). Chandigarh is the first smoke-free city in India.

question.content: The Government of launched Mukhyamantri Chaa Srami Kalyan Prakalpa Scheme for tea garden workers.

solution.content: Tripura (5th largest tea producing State in India). Assam is the largest tea-producing state in India followed by West Bengal. Jorhat has the world famous Tocklai Experimental Centre. China (1st) and India (2nd) are the largest tea producing countries in the world.

question.content: The Kashi Yatra Scheme introduced by the government of .....

solution.content: Karnataka government has launched the Kashi Yatra scheme. It offers cash assistance of Rs 5,000 to pilgrims who visit the Kashi Vishwanath Temple (Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh). The Kashi Vishwanath Temple (Jyotirlingas) is dedicated to Lord Shiva. The current structure was built by the Ahilyabai Holkar of Indore (Maratha ruler) in the year 1780.

question.content: India's first Olympic Values Education Programme (OVEP) was launched in _

solution.content: Odisha. The Olympic Values Education Programme (OVEP) of the International Olympic Committee (IOC) was launched in Odisha by Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik, in collaboration with the Abhinav Bindra Foundation Trust (ABFT). 10C Headquarters: Lausanne (Switzerland), Founded: 23 June 1894 (Paris, France).

question.content: In which district of Maharashtra is Ralegan Siddhi, a small village that has become an example for watershed development, situated?

solution.content: Ahmednagar. Extra Facts Integrated Watershed Development Programme (IWMP) objective is to cover 55 million hectares of rain fed land by 2027. Other Initiatives - Hariyali (Central Government), Neeru-Meeru programme (Andhra Pradesh) and Arvary Pani Sansad (Alwar, Rajasthan). Tamil Nadu has made water harvesting structures in the houses compulsory.

question.content: In which state in India is Chandratal wetland located?

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. Important Wetlands Pong dam, Renuka Wetland (Himachal Pradesh), Tampara Lake (Odisha), Yashwant Sagar (Madhya Pradesh), Chitrangudi Bird Sanctuary (Tamil Nadu), Shallbugh Wetland (Jammu and Kashmir) Thane Creek (Maharashtra), Kanjirankulam Bird Sanctuary (Tamil Nadu) etc.

question.content: Which state of India has set up District Investment Promotion Agencies (DIPA)?

solution.content: Odisha Government has set up District Investment Promotion Agencies (DIPA) to promote and facilitate investment across the State.

question.content: Bidar Fort is situated in which state of India?

solution.content: Karnataka. List of forts in Karnataka- Mudgal Fort, Raichur Fort, Jaladurga Fort, Belgaum Fort.

question.content: The HVJ pipeline does NOT run through the state of

solution.content: Karnataka. HVJ an abbreviation for Hazira - Vijaipur Jagdishpur is India's first cross-state gas pipeline that passes through Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, and NCT. It was started in 1986 after the incorporation of GAIL Limited.

question.content: The Janjira Fort is situated on a small island in the Arabian sea, off the coast of

solution.content: Maharashtra. Janjira fort is situated on an oval-shaped rock off the Arabian Sea coast near the port town of Murud, 165 km south of Mumbai, Maharashtra. Some other forts in Maharashtra: Lohagad fort, Daulatabad fort, Raigad fort, Shaniwarwada fort pune, Sindhu Garh fort, Pratapgarh fort, Rajmachi fort, Korigad fort, Sinhagad fort etc.

question.content: Which of the following is a limestone cave in India?

solution.content: Borra Caves is a limestone cave located in the Ananthagiri hills of the Araku Valley of the Alluri Sitharama Raju district in Andhra Pradesh. Undavalli Caves- Amravati, Andhra Pradesh. Varaha Cave- Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu. Bhimbetka Caves Amcha khurd, Madhya Pradesh.

question.content: Agumbe, a biodiversity-rich region that receives 7640 mm of average annual rainfall in South India, is located in which state?

solution.content: Karnataka. Agumbe ('Cobra Capital' of India) is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is famous for its rich biodiversity, waterfalls (Onake Abbi, Bakarna, and Jogi Gundi fall), and red-hazy sun-set over the Arabian Sea.

question.content: In which of the following Indian states will you find the Buxa Fort?

solution.content: Buxa Fort is located in the Buxa Tiger Reserve, Alipurduar district, in West Bengal. Kurumbera Fort is located at Gagneswar, West Bengal. Fort William, Kolkata, West Bengal.

question.content: Odisha has set _ as the target year for providing 100% functional household tap water connections in every rural household.

solution.content: 2023-24. Goa is the first state in India to provide 100 per cent tap water connections in the rural areas covering 2.30 lakh households.

question.content: In which city of Gujarat will you find the Uparkot Buddhist Caves?

solution.content: Junagadh. Some of the famous Buddhist Caves in India are Ajanta Caves in Maharashtra, Ellora Caves in Maharashtra, Kanheri Caves in Maharashtra, Bhaja Caves in Maharashtra, Barabar Caves in Bihar, Nagarjunakonda Caves in Andhra Pradesh, Dhauli Caves in Orissa, Lalitgiri Caves in Orissa, Ratnagiri Caves in Orissa, Junnar Caves in Maharashtra, Karla Caves in Maharashtra.

question.content: The rooftop of Guru Hemkund Sahib is in the shape of an upturned

solution.content: Lotus. Guru Hemkund Sahib (the holiest shrine of Sikhs) located at Chamoli district of Uttarakhand.

question.content: In which of the following Indian states will you find the Tibetan Buddhist Golden Temple?

solution.content: Karnataka. 12 Famous Buddhist temple and monasteries in India are Mahabodhi Temple (Bodh Gaya), Mahaparinirvana Temple (Kushinagar), Ramadhan Stupa Temple (Kushinagar), Wat Thai Temple (Kushinagar), Thiksey Monastery (Leh), Mindrolling Monastery (Dehradun), Ghoom Monastery (Darjeeling), Namdroling Monastery & Golden Temple (Mysore), Rumtek Monastery (Gangtok), Tsuglagkhang Temple Complex (Dharamsala), Dhamekh Stupa (Sarnath), Vishwa Shanti Stupa (Rajgir).

question.content: What is located inside the premises of Akhal Takht Sahib?

solution.content: Golden Temple. Shri Guru Hargobind Singh laid the foundation stone of the Akal Takht building in 1605. Paonta Sahib was founded by the Tenth Sikh guru, Guru Gobind Singh. Patna Sahib was built by Maharaja Ranjit Singh. Gurudwara Bangla Sahib is known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan.

question.content: Litti Chokha is a famous cuisine of which of the following states?

solution.content: Bihar. Litti Chokha basically consists of wheat and sattu. It originated centuries ago as a staple food in the court of Magadha.

question.content: In the context of the culture of Uttarakhand, 'Kafuli' is the name of a:

solution.content: cuisine. Kafuli is a delicacy of Uttarakhand prepared out of leafy greens such as palak (spinach) and methi (fenugreek) leaves. It is also known as Dhapdi in Garhwal.

question.content: In which of the following states of India is the buffalo breed named 'Banni' mainly reared?

solution.content: Gujarat. Banni buffalo is also known as "Kutchi" or "Kundi". It is a breed of buffalo found primarily in the Kutch district of Gujarat, India.

question.content: Which State/Union Territory is traditionally associated with a yogurt -based gravy dish called 'Yakhni'?

solution.content: Jammu and Kashmir. Yakhni is a yogurt-based mutton gravy that seems to have originated in Persia and percolated to Kashmir.

question.content: Which of the following Indian states was one of the worst affected by the tsunami on 26th December 2004?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. The magnitude of the Indian Ocean Tsunami 2004 was 9.1.

question.content: Which of the following palaces is located in Thiruvananthapuram?

solution.content: Kanakakunnu Palace is situated in Thiruvananthapuram near the Napier museum, India. Chowmahalla Palace is the palace of the Nizams of Hyderabad. Amber Fort is a fort located in Amber, Rajasthan. The Ujjayanta Palace is a museum and the former palace of the Kingdom of Tripura situated in Agartala.

question.content: Janapada Geete, which includes the vachanas of Basavanna, associated with the state of

solution.content: Karnataka. Janapada Geete, Jana means people or tribe and pada means verse/rhyme.

question.content: Pochampally Ikat sarees and dress materials, famous for their traditional geometric patterns belong to the state of

solution.content: Telangana. Traditional Sarees and States: Banarasi Saree - Uttar Pradesh, Kanjivaram Silk Saree Tamil Nadu, Nauvari Saree - Maharashtra, Tant Saree - West Bengal.

question.content: 'Muya Awandru' is a traditional food of this Indian state

solution.content: Tripura. Muya awandru is a dish prepared with bamboo shoots, berma (fermented fish), parsley, and green chilies. It is a rice flour-based gravy.

question.content: Which of the following is NOT a town of Karnataka?

solution.content: Bhusawal (Maharashtra). It is situated on the banks of the Tapi river.

question.content: Bombay state was split along linguistic lines, forming Maharashtra and _, in the year 1960.

solution.content: Gujarat. The States Reorganisation Committee report was to be implemented in 1956.

question.content: In which of the following states is the Stanley Reservoir located?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. Stanley Reservoir (Mettur dam) is one of the largest fishing reservoirs in South India. Its main source of water is the River Kaveri.

question.content: In which Indian state is 'Pookode Lake' located?

solution.content: Kerala. 10 Famous Lakes in Kerala: Ashtamudi Lake, Periyar Lake, Vembanad Lake, Pookode Lake, Vellayani Lake, Paravur Lake, Punnamada Lake, Sasthamkotta Lake, Mananchira Lake, Veeran Puzhal Lake.

question.content: In which state of India does the 'Weinia Falls' lie?

solution.content: Meghalaya. Weinia Falls is also known as Kshaid Weinia. Kunchikal Falls in Shimoga District of Karnataka is the highest waterfall in India and the second biggest waterfall in Asia.

question.content: Churahi, Mandeali and Keonthali are dialects spoken in the state of:

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. Other Pahari dialects spoken here - Chambiali, Churahi, Mandeli, Himachali and Kuluhi.

question.content: Which of the following is the State Tree of Maharashtra?

solution.content: Mango. Scientific name Mangifera indica. Amba (Marathi), Family: Anacardiaceaе.

question.content: Which of the following is the state bird of Rajasthan?

solution.content: Son Chiraiya (Great Indian Bustard). State Animal: Chinkara and Camel. State Dance- Ghoomer, State tree- Khejri (Prosopis Cineraria), State Flower- Rohida (Tecomella Undulata).

question.content: The Mattancherry palace is situated in:

solution.content: Kerala. The Mattancherry Palace (Dutch Palace) was included in the "tentative list" of UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

question.content: Which state among the following is the largest producer of coffee?

solution.content: Karnataka. Kodagu Chikmagalur and Hassan districts are major coffee producer regions of the state.

question.content: Kakinada, which enjoys a special place in the gas pipeline network of India, is located in:

solution.content: Andhra Pradesh. The East-West pipeline originates at Kakinada and travels up to Bharuch in Gujarat.

question.content: Kavaratti is the capital of which of the following Union Territories?

solution.content: Lakshadweep (Capital Kavaratti). India's smallest Union Territory Lakshadweep is an archipelago consisting of 36 islands with an area of 32 sq km.

question.content: 'Balchao' and 'Sorpotel' are the traditional culinary dishes of:

solution.content: Goa. Famous dishes of Goa are Goan Fish Curry, Prawn Balchao, Fish Recheado, Chicken, Xacuti, Chicken Cafreal, Shark Ambot Tik, Pork Sorpotel, Mussel, Rawa Fry, Caldeirada, Pork Vindaloo.

question.content: 'Tolu Bommalata' (leather shadow puppet show) is a traditional art form from the state of:

solution.content: Andhra Pradesh. Tholu means leather in Telugu and bommalu means dolls. Traditional Art Forms of Andhra Pradesh: Kuchipudi, Kalamkari Paintings, Buta Bommalu, Lambadi Nirmal Painting, Kolattam Bhamakalapam, Veeranatyam, Burrakatha, Dhimsa.

question.content: Which of the following is a site of archaeological importance in Jammu and Kashmir?

solution.content: Burzahom. Maski is a town and an archaeological site in the Raichur district of the state of Karnataka. Brahmagiri is a mountain range in the Western Ghats of south India.

question.content: Chutka Atomic Power Plant is situated in which of the following states?

solution.content: Madhya Pradesh (in Mandla district). Presently, India has 22 nuclear power reactors. Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant is the largest nuclear power station in India, situated in Kudankulam Tamil Nadu. Tarapur Atomic Power Station (1969) is located in Tarapur, Maharashtra is the first atomic power plant in India.

question.content: 'Panche' is a traditional sarong worn by the men in the state of

solution.content: Karnataka. Panche (Dhoti) - This unstitched cloth is wrapped around the legs and knotted around the waist.

question.content: Which of the following cities is closest to the location of Pushkar Fair?

solution.content: Ajmer. The Pushkar fair is one of India's largest camel, horse and cattle fairs.

question.content: In which present-day state will you find the Meguti temple?

solution.content: Karnataka. Megudii Jain temple is a monument in Aihole, constructed in 634 AD in Dravidian style of architecture.

question.content: Which of the following is the most literate district in India as per Census 2011?

solution.content: (b) Kottayam (d) Champhai Serchhip (Mizoram, 97.91%). As per Census 2011: State with highest literacy rate Kerala. State with lowest literacy rate - Bihar.

question.content: Which of the following Indian states has the famous tourist destination called Pamban Island?

solution.content: Island or Rameswaram Island is an island located between peninsular India and Sri Lanka, on the Adam's Bridge archipelago.

question.content: In which state is India's least densely populated district Dibang Valley located as per Census 2011?

solution.content: Arunachal Pradesh. Dibang is named after the Dibang River or the Talon as the Mishmis. It has an area of 9,129 square kilometers (3,525 sq mi).

question.content: Where is the Kudremukh iron ore mine located?

solution.content: Karnataka (Panambur, Mangalore). Other Iron Ore mine states Orissa, Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand.

question.content: In which of the following states/union territories is India's highest Meteorological Centre situated?

solution.content: Ladakh. Districts in the Union Territory of Ladakh - Two (Kargil district and Leh district).

question.content: In which of the following states is the famous Chitradurga Fort located?

solution.content: Karnataka (In Chitradurga District). The fort was built in stages between the 11th and 13th centuries by the dynastic rulers of the region, including the Chalukyas and Hoysalas, later the Nayakas of Chitradurga of the Vijayanagar Empire.

question.content: In which of the following states is Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Temple located?

solution.content: Andhra Pradesh. Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Temple is located in Srisailam, district Kurnool, in Andhra Pradesh. Sri Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Temple, Srisailam Temple is a historic temple dedicated to Shiva and Parvati.

question.content: The Sufi shrine Charar-e-Sharief (or Sharif) is located near city.

solution.content: Srinagar. Charar-e-Sharief, famous for the shrine of Sufi saint Sheikh Noor-ud-Din Noorani.

question.content: Which of the following is the state flower of Manipur?

solution.content: Shirui Lily (Lilium mackliniae). Foxtail Orchids (Rhynchostylis retusa) or Kopou Flower is a flower of Assam. Pink Rhododendron is a flower of Himachal.

question.content: Which of the following states emerged as a separate state in 1963?

solution.content: Nagaland became the 16th state of India on 1 December 1963. Other states were conferred statehood on Mizoram (20 February 1987), Arunachal Pradesh (20 February 1987), Tripura (21 January 1972).

question.content: Which present day Indian state came into existence as the Mysore state in 1953?

solution.content: Karnataka (renamed in 1973). Karnataka is the largest state in South India and the sixth-largest (area wise) in India. Mysore was formed on 1 November 1956.

question.content: 'Rahide' is a long scarf worn by the women of to protect their head from the cool breeze as well as to show their traditional social affinity.

solution.content: Himachal Pradesh. Woven in all shapes and sizes, Rahide comes in different fabrics and patterns.

question.content: Which modern-day Indian state was created on 1 April 1937 as the United Provinces by the Britishers?

solution.content: Uttar Pradesh came into existence on 1 April 1937 as a result of the shortening of "United Provinces of Agra and Oudh". Arunachal Pradesh - 20 February 1987 55th constitutional amendment act, 1986. Sikkim - 16 May, 197536th constitutional amendment act, 1975.

question.content: In which year did the state of Himachal Pradesh come into existence?

solution.content: 25th January 1971. The State of Himachal Pradesh Act was passed by Parliament on 18th December 1970. Thus it emerged as the eighteenth state of the Indian Union.

question.content: 'Sandalwood' is the state tree of

solution.content: (Karnataka) (d) Rajasthan Karnataka. Mysore city is also known as 'Sandalwood city of India'.

question.content: Dogri language is mainly spoken in which of the following states/union territories?

solution.content: Jammu and Kashmir. Dogri is spoken by approximately 2.3 million people. It is an officially recognized language in India.

question.content: 'Aloo Posto' is a traditional delicacy of which state of India?

solution.content: West Bengal. A traditional Bengali lunch - bhaat (rice), aloo bhaja (fried potato), begun bhaja (fried eggplant), dal (lentils), chingri macher malaikari (prawn in coconut gravy), mutton, chatni, papad, and mishti (sweets).

question.content: The Barabati Sports Stadium is located in the state of:

solution.content: Odisha (Cuttack). The Barabati Sports Stadium was established in 1958 by the Association. Odisha Cricket

question.content: In which state is the hill station Matheran located?

solution.content: Maharashtra. Hill stations of Maharashtra Lonavala, Khandala, Mahabaleshwar, Igatpuri, Panchgani, Karjat, Lavasa.

question.content: 'Ramoji Film City' is located close to which of the following cities? (b) Hyderabad

solution.content: Hyderabad. It is the largest integrated film city in the world and it has been certified by the Guinness World Records as the largest studio complex in the world.

question.content: Vailankanni (Velankanni) is a pilgrim centre located in the _ district of Tamil Nadu.

solution.content: с) Nagapattinam. This city is famous for the church of Mother Mary and handlooms and silk. Vailankanni (Velankanni) is also known as the Lourdes of the East.

question.content: The longest continuous wall in India, the second longest in the world, is at _ Fort.

solution.content: Kumbhalgarh (Rajasthan). The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world.

question.content: At which of the following places is the Nehru Memorial Museum and Library located?

solution.content: New Delhi. The Nehru Memorial Museum and Library aims to preserve and reconstruct the history of the Indian Independence Movement.

question.content: Salsette Island is situated in which state of India?

solution.content: Maharashtra (on India's west coast). The highest point is the conical peak of Kanheri in Borivali National Park on the northern reaches of Salsette island.

question.content: Which of the following places in India would you visit to see Mughal emperor Humayun's library?

solution.content: Delhi (India). Sher Mandal or Humayun's library is a 16th century historic building within the Purana Qila.

question.content: At which of the following hill stations can tourists visiting in winter experience living in igloos?

solution.content: Manali.

question.content: The Char-Dham Highway Project will connect four holy places: Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath and Badrinath. To which Indian state do these places belong?

solution.content: Uttarakhand. The foundation stone of the project was laid by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 27 December 2016 at Parade Ground in Dehradun. Length 825 km.

question.content: Which state in India was the first to introduce the 'Mid-day Meal Scheme' for school children?

solution.content: Tamil Nadu. The basic objective of this scheme is to enhance enrolment in schools. Nodal Ministry: Ministry of Education.

question.content: Yadgir, Bidar and Gadag are districts in the state of

solution.content: Karnataka.

question.content: National Highway 18 does NOT pass through which of the following states?

solution.content: Bihar. NH 18 passes through the states of West Bengal, Jharkhand and Odisha.

question.content: At which place was the Saffron Mission initiated in 2010?

solution.content: Jammu and Kashmir.

question.content: Which of the following is NOT a twin city of India?

solution.content: Thrissur and Thiruvalla. Famous twin cities of India: Hyderabad and Secunderabad, Vijayawada and Amaravati, Kochi and Ernakulam, Kolkata and Howrah, Jalpaiguri and Siliguri.

question.content: Which city of India is known as 'Athens of the East'?

solution.content: Madurai (Tamil Nadu). It is located on the banks of River Vaigai.
